WorkItem.Description:
So after being spoilt by the awesomeness of C# syntax highlighting for so long (and now finally C++!), it has been somewhat depressing entering the world of TypeScript, because none of my classes, interfaces, etc. are colored any differently from the surrounding text (they're all black). I like my code to look all pretty and colorful.
Is it too much to ask to make them use the "User Types" color as specified in the VS font options?
That would be uber-awesome.
Cheers
WorkItem.Summary: Add ability to color User Type syntax

Comments.Message: Ah, now I realize this isn't the place for the VS tools. I guess the VSIX is not open source, or on codeplex. My apologies. But if you like, run into one of the VSIX guys in the corridor, can you ask them to implement this? :)

I'm pretty sure the TypeScript team is responsible for the VS TypeScript plugin.

There is an open issue for this already: http://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/392

Please vote for it.
Oh right, apologies, I guess that other issue was so brief and lacking the keywords I was looking for that it didn't come up in any of my searches.
